data: CARD STEMI Primary Percutaneous Coronary Intervention (PCI) - Initial Management
For ongoing management, please refer to CARD Primary Percutaneous Coronary Intervention (PCI) - Ongoing Management (Module)
Refer to ST-Elevation Angina Management Algorithm
Transfer to Cardiac Catheterization Lab STAT
Ensure ASA total dose of 160 mg has been given in the past 12 hours
160 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab-chew, first dose: STAT
80 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab-chew, first dose: STAT
Considerations when initiating and choosing P2Y12 Receptor Blocker:

For patients requiring long term anticoagulation, clopidogrel is preferred  
Avoid ticagrelor in patients with severe bradycardia (heart rate less than 50 bpm)
Hold ticagrelor or clopidogrel until after angiogram has been performed - PREFERRED
180 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab, first dose: STAT
Clopidogrel loading dose is only for patients not previously on clopidogrel for past 7 consecutive days and are 75 years or less
600 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab, first dose: STAT
On clopidogrel in the past 7 days
75 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab, first dose: STAT
60 unit/kg, IV, once, drug form: inj, first dose: NOW
5,000 unit, IV, once, drug form: inj, first dose: NOW

Avoid nitroglycerin if any of the following are present:  - SBP below 90 mmHg or if more than 30 mmHg drop from baseline  - Suspected right ventricular infarction  - Recent use of phosphodiesterase inhibitors: within 24 hours for sildenafil [VIAGRA] and vardenafil [LEVITRA] and within 48 hours for tadalafil [CIALIS]
1 spray, sublingual, q5min, PRN other (see comment), drug form: spray
nitroglycerin titratable infusion (0.2 mg/mL) in D5W standard
Titrate, IV, 10 mcg/min starting rate, 0 mcg/min minimum rate, 200 mcg/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: Titrate by 10 mcg/min, q5min PRN for symptoms of ischemia; maintain SPB above 90 mmHg
dose range: 1 to 5 mg, IV, q1min, PRN other (see comment), drug form: inj
Basic Metabolic Panel (Lytes, Urea, Creat, Gluc)
